repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Writings and correspondence by or relating to the I︠U︡shkevich brothers and their family. Includes family photographs, and corrected typescripts of stories, plays and screenplays in Russian and in translation.

langmaterial.language: Materials in Russian, French, Yiddish, English, and German.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase from Nina IUshkevich and Adolf Pavolvich IUshkevich, 1988-1991.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Semen and Pavel IUshkevich Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Semen and Pavel IUshkevich Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Restricted Fragile material in box 4 may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies or photographic prints for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

bioghist.head: SEMEN SOLOMONOVICH IUSHKEVICH (1868-1927) & PAVEL SOLOMONOVICH IUSHKEVICH (1873-1945)
bioghist.p: Semen IUshkevich was born in Odessa in 1868, educated in the Jewish schools of the city and studied pharmacy at the University of St. Vladimir in Kiev and medicine in Paris. He began writing in the late 1890s, focusing on realistic depictions of middle-class Jewish life in Russia. He was an early contributor to Znanie , but later turned to playwriting. Sometime between 1917 and 1920, he emigrated with his family, finally settling in Paris. He continued writing plays, novels, and film scripts until his death in 1927.

Pavel IUshkevich was born in Odessa on June 29 (July 11), 1873. While he concentrated in his studies in mathematics, he was active in Marxist political groups. He later studied at the Faculty of Sciences of the Sorbonne and the University of St. Petersburg, eventually working as a journalist, editor, translator, though eventually disdaining politics. An expanded account of his life can be found in the biographical notes in folder 57-59.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Semen and Pavel IUshkevich Papers contain writings and correspondence by or relating to the IUshkevich brothers and their family as well as family photographs, and corrected typescripts of stories, plays and screenplays in Russian and in translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Semen Solomonovich IUshkevich Papers is organized in three subseries. Each is arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: "L'amour enchanté": typescript carbon signed, with holograph addition
"Maiden in Purple" (English language translation: typescript carbon
Epizody : partial English translation, corrected typescript
"Evrei": synopsis in English by Catherine Routsky, corrected typescript carbon
Golod, v gorode, otche nash ... (printed version)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes pieces of three separate books: Golod, Otche nash , Chetrye apostola, Zhalost, Tri kladbishcha, Novyi prorok, Gubernantka, V Avgustovskii vecher .

did.unittitle: Max Pfeffer: 2 TLS, with TL of Iushkevich's reply
Società Italiana degli Autori: printed invitation
Société des auteurs de films: 2 TLS with deposit receipts
Zwiazek literatów i dziennikarzy zydowskich w Warszawie: TLS
Aleksandr Bakhrakh, "Ob avtore Leona Dreia : in entire printed issue of Novoe russkoe Slovo
Ciné France Film: contract for "Les cinq Jules", typescript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Pavel Solomonovich IUshkevich Papers are organized in two subseries. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically. The diaries in Other Papers are arranged chronologically, followed by biographical notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Commentary by A. P. Iush- kevich, dated Dec. 3, 1989

did.unittitle: Biographical notes on Pavel Solomonovich IUshkevich

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Photocopy of holograph ms biographical sketch by A. P. IUshkevich, in Russian, a typescript of the same, and typescript of an English language translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, IUshkevich Family Papers , are organized in two subseries, which are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brother of the writer in uniform.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Son of Polina Finkel'shteyn, the writer's first wife.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs during the period of the author's enrollment at the Ecole de Médecine; a portrait taken at the Theatre named for K. Nezlobina, at the time when Chelovek vozdukha (Luftmensch) was being performed, and a portrait at the Izmailov dacha, where the writer spent many summers, Bol'shoi Fontan, Odessa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Bialik was a renowned Hebrew renaissance poet, during this time IUshkevich and Bialik had been working on a Sbornik .]

did.unittitle: Semen Solomonovich IUshkevich and unidentified actress
Znanie writers: Evgeny N. Chirikov, Semen Solomonovich IUshkevich, and S. Naidenov [pseud.]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 4: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
